thread.title: Ohio State-Rutgers facts, figures, notes and more
thread.title_full: Ohio State-Rutgers facts, figures, notes and more

title: Ohio State-Rutgers facts, figures, notes and more
text:
Ohio State-Rutgers facts, figures, notes and more 
Updated: Fri, Oct 23 2015, 10:52 AM 
CINCINATI (WKRC/AP) -- Here's a closer look at Saturday night's Ohio State-Rutgers football game: 
WHERE/WHEN: 8:12 p.m. Saturday night in High Point Solutions Stadium, Piscataway, New Jersey. 
RECORDS: Ohio State (7-0, 3-0 Big Ten), Rutgers (3-3, 1-2). 
OPENING LINE: Ohio State by 21. 
SERIES RECORD: Ohio State leads 1-0. 
WHAT'S AT STAKE 
Ohio State is looking to extend the nation's longest winning streak to 21 games and its conference regular-season winning streak to 28, one shy of the NCAA record set by Florida State of the ACC from 1992-95. Rutgers will be looking for its first win over a No. 1 team. 
KEY MATCHUP 
Rutgers porous defense against Ohio State backfield that features QB J.T. Barrett and TB Ezekiel Elliott. Barrett ran for 107 yards and two touchdowns and threw for 261 and three TDs in 56-17 win over Scarlet Knights last year. Elliott has rushed for 988 yards and 11 TDs this season. Rutgers defense is giving up 447.3 yards and Big Ten opponents have averaged 37 points. 
PLAYERS TO WATCH 
Ohio State: DE Joey Bosa. Rutgers coach Kyle Flood says the junior might be the best player in college football. The 6-foot-6, 275 pounder has 23½ career sacks and 43½ career tackles for losses, including nine this season. 
Rutgers: QB Chris Laviano. The first-year starter leads the Big Ten with a completion percentage of 69.2 and is second with an efficiency mark of 156.1. He has completed 45-of-60 attempts on first down plays, with 24 for a first down and eight touchdowns. He threw for a career-best 386 yards at Indiana, including 7-of-8 for 105 yards in the fourth quarter to engineer comeback. 
FACTS & FIGURES 
Buckeyes coach Urban Meyer is going for career win No. 150. Ohio State has won 15 consecutive true road games, the longest streak in the nation. ... Ohio State leads the Big Ten in scoring (37.0), rushing (242.1) and pass defense (143.6) and is second in total offense (455.6) and interceptions (eight). ...Rutgers is playing the No. 1 team for the fifth time in school history, the last time versus Miami in 2002. ... Scarlet Knights rallied from 25-point deficit to beat Indiana last weekend, tying the record they set last year against Maryland last year for largest deficit overcome in a win. It was the largest comeback in the NCAA this season. 
Photo: AP/Photo Jay LaPrete
